subject: English
learning_objectives: Identify the hand as a body part.
Understand that hands help us do many activities.
Use the word 'hand' in simple sentences.

core_explanation.simple_definition: A hand is a part of our body. We use our hands to hold things, write, eat and play.
core_explanation.expanded_definition: Each person has two hands. Our hands help us do many daily activities like clapping, drawing, picking up toys and helping others.

examples: I eat my food with my hand.
I clap my hands when I am happy.

nested_learning.intuition: Look at your hand. Move your fingers.
nested_learning.concept: This part is called a hand.
nested_learning.example: You hold your pencil with your hand.
nested_learning.application: Use your hand to wave at your friend.
nested_learning.practice: Show your hand to your teacher.

socratic_prompts: What do you use to hold your pencil?
Can you clap without using your hands?
How many hands do you have?

check_questions.question: Which body part helps you write?
How many hands do you have?

misconceptions.correction: We use hands to write, not legs.

bloom_mapping.apply: Use your hand to hold a book.
